ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel that I developed a good grasp of Coptic grammar and the skills required to translate Coptic over the course of the semester. I definitely noticed a big difference between my ability to handle and unfamiliar text and to break up and analyze pieces of grammar from the point at which we took the midterm to the final exam.
Coptic reading; using reference material, including dictionaries and lexica; exposure to scholarship on topics related to Coptic literature and history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the structure is spot-on; 1.5 semesters of grammar and then reading is a good format (though perhaps the first semester could go at a faster pace).

In the middle of the course (especially when we were first going through grammar in the first semester and in the beginning of this one), the pace felt kind of fast when it came to being able to remember all of the vocabulary and grammar. However, by the time we got to translating various texts at the end, I was glad that we went through the grammar/textbook a quickly as we did because actually diving into texts was showing me what points were actually most important to remember/review for the practical purposes of being able to translate.
Great balance between close reading and discussion of texts, and between group work, lectures, student presentations, and translation.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend the course to other student's looking to learn Coptic.
Yes, if they are interested in Coptic.
